::Feline::

She walked along side Chordate, smiling and purring softly.  She 
would take the tip of her tail and lightly brush the back of his neck 
evey few yards or so.  "I just want to thank you for your hospitality 
and kindness. I haven't been shown kindess for a long while now. 
Thank you." She moved closer and hugged his arm more than just 
holding on to it. She purred a little louder and smiled.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, KSLawdogg@c... wrote:
> (If anyone wonders why Chordate suddenly forgot about the intruder, 
it's 
> because I'm trying to buy Shadowarrior time to respond, since she 
hasn't yet, 
> and he's a little amazed at Feline)
> 
> Chordate:
> 
> 
> 
> Chordate's optics went wide when Feline took his arm.  He looked 
around to 
> see if anyone else was there.  "The mess hall?" he checked his 
internal 
> chronometer.  That intruder wasn't going anywhere, and if it did, 
the 
> intruder wasn't worth bothering with.
> 
> He was about to gather his senses, but lost them once more when he 
felt 
> Feline's soft furred tail rubbing up against his neck.  He regained 
his 
> senses after a few seconds, smiling to Feline.  "The mess 
hall...this way." 
> he said, walking down a corridor for the mess hall, but slow enough 
so that 
> she could hold on and keep up.
